sourcesContent:
import { useParams, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { useState } from 'react'; function RoommateProfile() { const { id } = useParams(); // Mock data - in a real app, you'd fetch this from an API const roommate = { id: 1, name: "Sarah Johnson", age: 22, occupation: "Graduate Student", major: "Computer Science", budget: 2000, leaseDuration: 12, smoking: "non-smoking", drinking: "non-drinking", genderPreference: "single-gender", cleanliness: "Very clean", sleepSchedule: "Early bird", hobbies: ["Reading", "Hiking", "Photography"], about: "Hi! I'm a grad student looking for a quiet and clean living space. I usually spend my weekends outdoors and love to cook.", image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1494790108377-be9c29b29330", socialLinks: { instagram: "@sarahjohnson", linkedin: "linkedin.com/in/sarahjohnson", } }; const [showContactInfo, setShowContactInfo] = useState(false); return (
{/* Header */}
Back to Search
{/* Profile Content */}
{/* Left Column - Photo and Quick Info */}

{roommate.name}

{roommate.age} • {roommate.occupation}

Available for {roommate.leaseDuration} months
${roommate.budget}/month
{/* Right Column - Detailed Info */}

About Me

{roommate.about}

Preferences & Lifestyle

Smoking: {roommate.smoking}
Drinking: {roommate.drinking}
Cleanliness: {roommate.cleanliness}
Sleep Schedule: {roommate.sleepSchedule}

Hobbies & Interests

{roommate.hobbies.map((hobby, index) => ( {hobby} ))}
{showContactInfo ? (

Contact Information

Instagram: {roommate.socialLinks.instagram}
LinkedIn: {roommate.socialLinks.linkedin}
) : ( )}
); } export default RoommateProfile;
